content.raw:
Hi Tyler,

Thanks for checking out my PR, I really appreciate your input!

I have changed the behavior of create\_xacro\_file to return False if a compliance test is failed and  only assert => fail when a macro is attempted that is not defined under the specified directory. \(this is because we presumably MUST have the default parameter values\) All fail conditions \(including the aforementioned assert=>fail\) now have a rospy logerr message. All compliance test failures will now be shown and the non compliance wamv will be generated. Also, during the error the box bounds are printed to help with debug.

ie: when running with thruster\_config\_bounds\_fail.yaml and sensor\_num\_fail.yaml

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/36110368-compliance_error.png)
